lessonTitle: THREE STEPS TO HEAVEN AND THE SIXTH LEVEL OF MAN

questions.question: According to the lesson, what are the six physical senses mentioned?
questions.correct_answer: Hearing, vision, smell, taste, touch, and sexual sensation.

questions.question: What does the first 'six' in 666 represent?
questions.correct_answer: The number of the beast - six isolated physical senses operating on instincts and reflexes, each directed inward showing only what the body experiences.

questions.question: How does the lesson interpret the progression from the level of Moses to the level of Jesus in terms of the theory of abstraction?
questions.correct_answer: Moses brought external law (letter of the law) where God is outside and above all people, while Jesus brought internal transformation (spirit of the law) where God is within each person, representing a move from external compulsion to internal understanding.

questions.question: What is the symbolic meaning of the Eucharist according to the theory of abstraction presented?
questions.correct_answer: Bread represents primordial earth and blood represents primordial heaven, both being primordial water over which the Spirit of God hovered. Through communion, humans symbolically participate in the creation of the world according to God's will.

questions.question: What does the third 'six' in 666 represent?
questions.correct_answer: The divine number representing complete abstraction from the sensual - divine love (Agape) through which the soul becomes aware of what another soul experiences.
